title: Python Basics - Printing & Simple I/O
concept: In this level you will learn how to print text using print(), read input using input(), and do simple operations. Focus on exact output format, without extra text.

challenges.title: Print with Quotes
challenges.description: Print the text including double quotes: "Learning Python"
challenges.starterCode: # output must include the double quotes

challenges.title: Two Lines
challenges.description: Print Hello on first line and Python on second line.

challenges.title: Greet by Name
challenges.description: Read a name and print: Hello <name>

challenges.title: Add Two Numbers
challenges.description: Read two integers and print their sum.
challenges.starterCode:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
# print sum

challenges.title: Multiply Two Numbers
challenges.description: Read two integers and print their product.
challenges.starterCode:
a, b = map(int, input().split())
# print product

challenges.title: Square of a Number
challenges.description: Read an integer n and print its square.

challenges.title: Simple Interest
challenges.description: Read principal P, rate R and time T (in years), compute simple interest = (P*R*T)/100 and print the value. You can print float or int.
challenges.inputDescription: Three numbers P R T separated by space.
challenges.starterCode:
P, R, T = map(float, input().split())
# compute simple interest

challenges.title: Formatted Message
challenges.description: Read a name and an integer age, then print exactly: <name> is <age> years old
challenges.inputDescription: First line: name, second line: age.
examples:
Input:
Ram
20
Output:
Ram is 20 years old
challenges.starterCode:
name = input().strip()
age = int(input())
# print formatted message
